snippet: Executives from a Malaysian company, Genting, proposed to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo a convention center and casino complex at the Aqueduct racetrack in October.
abstract: Political world in New York State has long speculated on where Gov Andrew M Cuomo got the idea for a huge, Malaysian-financed convention center in Queens; idea apparently originated at a fund raiser for Cuomo in Westchester County, where executives from Malaysian company Genting proposed the center and gave $400,000 to an advocacy group that was set up at Cuomo's urging.
lead_paragraph: Executives from a Malaysian company, Genting, proposed to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo a convention center and casino complex at the Aqueduct racetrack in October.

headline.seo: Genting Lobbied for Convention Center at Cuomo Fund-Raiser
headline.main: Gambling Group Lobbied for Convention Center at Cuomo Fund-Raiser
headline.print_headline: Convention Project Tied to Cuomo Event
